intro: Gyrostemon cyclotheca, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant has small, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in harsh environments. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators like bees and birds. Gyrostemon cyclotheca is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
